, System overview
1.1 System overview
1.1.1 Project SIMOS 12.1
1.1.1.1 Engine
Description: AUDI R4 1,8l/2,0l TFSI 
Charge cycle: DOHC, 4 valves/cylinder; continous va riable valve control 
Intake and exhaust (IVVT), 2 step variable valve lift only exhaust 
 
Compression:
Exhaust system: one bank for cylinder 1,2,3 and 4; single-flow 
 
Other features:  variable port flap with feedback 
electronic throttle control 
continous variable valve timing for intake and outlet camshaft 
(IVVT) 
 
1.1.1.2 Basic data of engine:
Number of cylinders: 4 
Piston displacement: 1.984 cm ? 
 
Bore: 82,5 mm 
Stroke: 92,8 mm 
Length of piston rod: 144 mm 
Offset of pisten pin 0,6 mm (to pressure side) 
relationship of connecting rod  
control reaction time intake open 28� after.OT 
exhaust close 22� before. OT. 1 mm stroke 
camshaft phasing both intake an exhaust 40� CRK 
 
.
Length of event: intake 208� 11 mm 
Intake small cam: 50� and 120� for "Baustufe Motor 2" 
Exhaust 210� 10 mm

, System overview
1.1.2 Cylinder numbering and ?ring order
1.1.2.1 SIMOS 12.1
1.1.2.1.1 Cylinder numbering
In the software the cylinders are numbered logically with 0...3. The relating physical cylinders are numbered
from 1...4. If in the speci?cation a cylinder- speci?c- variable is mentioned with ...CYL then always the logic value
is ment.
The ?ring order of the engine follows continuously from logic 0 to logic 3, whereas the physical ?ring order is
shown as follows: 1 - 3 - 4 - 2.
1.1.2.2 Cylinder banks and exhaust branches
The engine has 1 cylinder bank and 1 exhaust branche.
The following graphic shows the logical and physical cylinder numbering, the bank and exhaust branch num-
bering:
4
 
3
 
2
 
1
 
CAT Turbo 
The relation between logical and physical cylinder numbers, cylinder bank and exhaust branch is as follows:
SIMOS 12.1
Logic cylinder 
number  
Physical cylinder 
number  Injector Hw 
0 1  
1 3  
2 4  
3 2  
 
So, the physical ?ring order is 1 - 3 - 4 - 2
1.1.3 De?nition Nockenwelle - Kurbelwelle
1.1.3.1 SIMOS 12.1
1.1.3.1.1 Allocation of CRK- / CAM angle

, System overview
� General informaltion:
The plotted curve shape refers to the electric image of the CRK- resp. CAM disc (Low: air, High: metal)
The electric CAM-signal together with an used hall sensor are inverse to the mechanical map of the segment
disc.
Crankshaft trigger wheel (CRK)
The ?rst falling edge after the reference gap is located 72� CRK before ignition TDC of the ?rst cylinder.
Camshaft trigger wheel intake (CAM)
The motor is equipped with a so-called ?rapid starting trigger wheel? with 4 asynchronous ?high? segments and
4 ?low? segments (2 short, 2 long)
The electric NW-signal together with an used hall sensor are inverse to the mechanical map of the ?rapid
starting wheel?!
An (electric) falling edge of the intake camshaft signal is located 45,6� CRK after ignition TDC of the ?rst cylinder
(about 21. tooth after the gap)
Afterwards an electric falling edge will be detected all 180� CRK. An electric rising CAM edge of the intake
camshaft is located at the 14. tooth after the gap (1,6� CRK after ZOT1).
This angle information refers to the late end position of the camshaft (reference setting).
The angle resp. tooth information of the camshaft segment wheels are ideal values, the exact values will be
adapted.
� Positioning of the CRK and CAM wheel:

1.2.3 Variant con?guration of the different hardware samples
� General information:
Via adjustment of the variable C_CONF_PIN_VAR different pin de?nitions (hardware variants) are switched/
initialized. The actual SW supports the following different variants:
C_CONF_PIN_VAR = 0 SIMOS18.1/ SIMOS18.6 variant (ECU basic variant, e.g. MQB TFSI AVS 162kW EU6 or MLB
TFSI 165kW EU6)
File: BL100301.00F
1056Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without

, PIN con?guration of connector
C_CONF_PIN_VAR = 1 SIMOS18.3/ SIMOS18.7 variant (e.g. basic variant for chinese market)
C_CONF_PIN_VAR = 2 SIMOS18.1/ SIMOS18.6 PAG variant (e.g. Porsche Macan)
C_CONF_PIN_VAR = 3 SIMOS18.2 variant for PQ35 LC
C_CONF_PIN_VAR = 4 SIMOS18.1/ SIMOS18.6 variant for D4PA
The initialization of the different variants is executed at system start up (no change at running ECU). The
calibration/ setting of the con?guration byte C_CONF_PIN_VAR is selected from ECU ?ash (= reference page of
application system).

, Standard analog inputs
Name Acquisition rate (ms) Port
/ Channel
Remark
V_PORT_1_RAW 10
V_PORT_2_RAW 10
VCC_1 10
VCC_2 10
ACQ_MC_1 40
ACQ_MC_2 40 GEN
� Application Conditions
Activation: every engine operation state
� Function Description
every 10ms:
VCC_1 =TRL_ADC_Result_VREF_1
VCC_2 =TRL_ADC_Result_VREF_2
if NC_PORT_NR > 0 (at least 1 port flap available)
then V_PORT_1_RAW = ACTION_INFR_GetVpPort1(<PRM_VP_PORT_1>)
V_PORT_1 = IP_V_PORT_1_COR (V_PORT_1_RAW)
if NC_PORT_NR > 1
then V_PORT_2_RAW = 0 V (single bank system)
V_PORT_2 = 0 V (single bank system)
endif
endif
every 40ms:
ACQ_MC_1 = HAL_ADC_GetPvs2Diag
ACQ_MC_2 = ACTION_INFR_GetVpPvs2Mon
